The Art of the German Empire (; before September 1939 titled 'The Art of the Third Reich,' ) was a state-published art magazine in Nazi Germany, and the country's biggest art publication. It began publication in January 1937 and was published monthly until September 1944; occasionally in double issues.
The magazine was very strict and selective in what it featured, and extremely few of its arist were women. Exhibits at the Great German Art Exhibition amounted for approximately one third of the magazine's illustrations. In 1939, its circulation was 50,000 copies.
